title: A Butcher’s Guide to Making Healthy Bone Broth
sub_head: Well versed in the many health benefits of bone broth, this butcher offers it on tap at her Denver shop. Here, her pro tips for producing a rich, delicious broth full of vital nutrients at home.
body:
STASHED IN THE BACK of any whole-animal butcher shop, a gold mine awaits the cook savvy enough to ask: bones, ready for transformation into a rich, nutritious broth. All you really need are bones, water, acid and salt. Simmered for hours, the bones break down, releasing collagen, gelatin, nutrients and minerals into an intense liquid.
Denver butcher, nutritional therapist and farmer Kate Kavanaugh is one of the country’s leading evangelizers for what she calls the “mother potion.” She considers bone broth “the skeleton, the foundation, the backbone of my kitchen and many of my nutritional protocols.”
